Breach Detection At Scale With PROJECT SPACECRAB
The more advice I read about KRACK, the dumber I feel.

For those who weren't there, my presentation at AISA last week - "Slaughtering Sacred Cows" - was about our industry's sense of self-importance, and flagrant use of misleading data and over-hyped warnings... amongst other things.
Example: "Until you can patch all your devices, it is highly recommended to disable wifi. This may seem extreme; however, this attack is significant enough to warrant this recommendation"

Right.  So we're saying that everyone is at such peril, despite the fact an attacker needs to be within range of the victim, the vast majority of apps now using TLS, and the wide availability of VPN software, that we are going to basically stop their business.

I'd love to see the cost-benefit analysis of turning off WiFi when so many offices now don't have network cables.  Benefit: We're unlikely to be compromised by the guy physically standing outside our office doing a really complicated attack.  Cost: Our business stops working.

Crowdsourced security for web and mobile applications. Bugcrowd runs managed bug bounties, where members of our curated crowd of security researchers compete to be the first to report security flaws for cash and kudos. Facebook, Google and Paypal have used this approach for years, now Bugcrowd makes it available to technology dependant companies of all shapes and sizes.

I oversee and coordinate our security efforts across software engineering, operations and information technology to ensure that the information assets of Atlassian and those entrusted to us by our customers are protected.I partner with our executive leadership to ensure Atlassian's Security Program fulfils the needs of the business, delivers product and service integrity and obligation compliance. I'm accountable for our large scale SaaS security, secure product development, traditional enterprise security and the promotion of a security culture across the company.

-Launching a comprehensive security program, including policies, supporting key business drivers.-Developing a new security framework aligned to industry standards and socialised throughout the organisation.-Consistently high feedback on presentations delivered covering security issues and education.-Identified and successfully implemented a comprehensive Security Event and Incident Management system to provide greater visibility of threats.-Developed a 3 year plan for Cochlear’s security approach, covering strategy, privacy impacts and platform direction.-Identified business risks and supported owners to understand and mitigate those risks.-Created a culture to encourage the discussion of security within the business, including workshop facilitation.-Identifying and sponsoring the implementation of a Mobile Device Management platform.-Develop and manage a budget for Information Security.-Managed a number of key remediation projects covering;--Simplifying Identity management.--Improved Patching compliance from 15% to over 95% of all systems.--Converting Antivirus platform to a common platform with substantial lowering of infection rates.--Defined new security configuration standards for systems, enhancing systems management.
